verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>,
I have heard<WH8085> many such things<WH7227>: Miserable<WH5999> comforters are ye all<WH5162>.
Shall vain<WH7307> words<WH1697> have an end<WH7093>? Or what provoketh<WH4834> thee that thou answerest<WH6030>?

I also could speak<WH1696> as ye do<WH3863>; If your soul<WH5315> were<WH3426> in my soul<WH5315>'s stead<WH2266>, I could join words<WH4405> together against you<WH5128>, And shake my head<WH7218> at you<WH1119>.
But I would strengthen<WH553> you with<WH1119> my mouth<WH6310>, And the solace<WH5205> of my lips<WH8193> would assuage your grief<WH2820>.
Though I speak<WH1696>, my grief<WH3511> is not assuaged<WH2820>; And though I forbear<WH2308>, what am I eased<WH1980>?
But now he hath made me weary<WH3811>: Thou hast made desolate<WH8074> all my company<WH5712>.
And thou hast laid fast hold<WH7059> on me<WH5707>, which is a witness against me<WH3585>: And my leanness riseth up<WH6965> against me<WH6030>, It testifieth to my face<WH6440>.
He hath torn<WH2963> me in his wrath<WH639>, and persecuted<WH7852> me<WH2786>; He hath gnashed upon me with his teeth<WH8127>: Mine adversary<WH6862> sharpeneth<WH3913> his eyes upon me<WH5869>.
They have gaped<WH6473> upon me with their mouth<WH6310>; They have smitten<WH5221> me upon the cheek<WH3895> reproachfully<WH2781>: They gather<WH4390> themselves together against me<WH3162>.
God <WH410> delivereth<WH5462> me to the ungodly<WH5760>, And casteth me into<WH3399> the hands<WH3027> of the wicked<WH7563>.
I was at ease<WH7961>, and he brake me asunder<WH6565>; Yea<WH270>, he hath taken me by the neck<WH6203>, and dashed me to pieces<WH6327>: He hath also set me up<WH6965> for his mark<WH4307>.
His archers<WH7228> compass me round about<WH5437>; He cleaveth<WH6398> my reins<WH3629> asunder<WH6398>, and doth not spare<WH2550>; He poureth out<WH8210> my gall<WH4845> upon the ground<WH776>.
He breaketh<WH6555> me with breach<WH6556> upon<WH6440> breach<WH6556>; He runneth<WH7323> upon me like a giant<WH1368>.
I have sewed<WH8609> sackcloth<WH8242> upon my skin<WH1539>, And have laid<WH5953> my horn<WH7161> in the dust<WH6083>.
My face<WH6440> is red<WH2560> with weeping<WH1065>, And on my eyelids<WH6079> is the shadow of death<WH6757>;
Although there is no violence<WH2555> in my hands<WH3709>, And my prayer<WH8605> is pure<WH2134>.
O earth<WH776>, cover<WH3680> not thou my blood<WH1818>, And let my cry<WH2201> have no resting<WH4725> -place.
Even now<WH5707>, behold, my witness is in heaven<WH8064>, And he that voucheth<WH7717> for me is on high<WH4791>.
My friends<WH7453> scoff<WH3887> at me<WH5869>: But mine eye poureth out<WH1811> tears unto God<WH433>,
That he would maintain<WH3198> the right of a man<WH1397> with God<WH433>, And of a son of man<WH120> with his neighbor<WH1121>!
For when a few<WH4557> years<WH8141> are come<WH857>, I shall go<WH1980> the way<WH734> whence I shall not return<WH7725>.
